review.title: A Fuzzy Logic System to Analyze a Student's Lifestyle
review.abstract: A college student's life can be primarily categorized into domains such as education, health, social and other activities which may include daily chores and travelling time. Time management is crucial for every student. A self realisation of one's daily time expenditure in various domains is therefore essential to maximize one's effective output. This paper presents how a mobile application using Fuzzy Logic and Global Positioning System (GPS) analyzes a student's lifestyle and provides recommendations and suggestions based on the results.

sections.text: Keywords - Fuzzy Logic, GPS, Android ApplicationI. INTRODUCTIONA college student's life is multidimensional. Students are expected to be academically excellent, physically fit and socially active along with managing their daily tasks and pursuing their interests. This structure would not only help students engage in all activities, but also help them lead balanced lives. Ultimately, this practice would help them make better career decisions based on their interests. For such a practice, one must invest a threshold of time and effort in all activities. However, only a certain amount of students is involved and excel themselves in such a practice. Recently, various student problems have been addressed by researchers using Fuzzy Logic. Patel et al. sections.heading: IV. CONCLUDING REMARKS
sections.text: The dynamics of a student studying at University A and a student at University B can vary greatly due to many factors such as geographical location, nature of the university and infrastructure, so the parameters for analyzing these two students should be significantly different. This paper gives the user the flexibility to configure various attributes such as weight of tags, type of membership features and number of recommendations, which would provide better outcomes. Long-term applications are extensive, and this method can be used to access the performance of all students at a university, and the results can be shared with the university so that the university can take appropriate action for the benefit of students in general.
